availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Lelia Elvessa Martin in Bath County on July 31, 1856. Father of William S. Gudgell, Frank P. Gudgell, Oakie R. Gudgell, and Howard C. Gudgell. Attorney in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 3.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 4.
